t: Packfleet
s: Part of this transition means we’ll be saying goodbye to Packfleet as a brand. Starting in 2021 we built a product and service that delighted hundreds of merchants and delivered literally millions of parcels in electric vehicles across London to happy recipients.

t: 10. Packfleet | Startups 100 2024
s: January 8, 2024 - Following high-profile worker strikes at Amazon and Royal Mail last year, Packfleet was founded on the basic principle that its posties are human beings (somebody tell Jeff Bezos). Drivers are brought on as full-time staff, receive full parental leave and sick pay, and are paid 30% higher than the industry average. This empathetic approach is then passed down the supply chain to the end user. Aided by the brand...

t: Amazon Strikes: Ethical Couriers Fixing the Delivery Sector
s: January 23, 2023 - Thomas has previously declared in interviews that Packfleet “is never going to challenge Royal Mail”. With the string of recent controversies that have impacted the business, we ask: does he now feel differently? “On parcels, I think there’s a huge opportunity,” he nods. “There are four or five large UK parcel brands...

t: List of Amazon brands - Wikipedia
s: November 26, 2024 - Amazon offers multiple lines of privately labeled products. These are available on Amazon.com, Amazon Fresh, Prime Pantry, Prime Now, Amazon Go, and Whole Foods Market. Amazon houses its in-house brand offerings under the “Our Brands” label, which is separate from exclusive brands.

t: Van Life: Why A Former Monzo Executive Has Launched A Tech-Enabled Courier Company Aimed First At Small Businesses.
s: January 18, 2023 - When Monzo marketing executive, Tristan Thomas launched a wine subscription service with his brother during lockdown, he felt that courier companies were not serving small businesses well. In response, he launched Packfleet. But can you bring anything new to the delivery game in 2023?
